net.letscode.game.api.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.letscode.game.api.entity.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JsonSerializable, TargetedSerializable<Entity>, EventBusProvider
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Entity2D

    public class Entity
extends Object
implements TargetedSerializable<Entity>, EventBusProvider
    Defines a basic entity. An entity is essentially some server-side object, unique only in that it is capable of joining a zone. Additionally, entities have controllers that allow them to perform actions within the zone.
    Author:
    timothyb89

      • getZones

        public List<Zone> getZones()
        Gets the list of zones this entity is currently a member of. This list can not be modified; Zone.addEntity(Entity) should be used to join a zone instead.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of zones this entity is a member of

      • getZoneByType

        public <T extends Zone> T getZoneByType(Class<T> zone)
        Returns the first instance of a Zone of the given type that this entity is a member of. The zone list is maintained by
        Type Parameters:
        T - the Zone subclass
        Parameters:
        zone - the class of the zone to retrieve
        Returns:
        the first matching zone, or null if none is found

      • _enteredZone

        public void _enteredZone(Zone zone)
        An internal method intended to be called exclusively by Zone when this entity has been added to the zone. Specifically, this appends the given zone to the internal zone list, and fires a EntityZoneEnteredException.
        Parameters:
        zone - The zone entered

      • _exitedZone

        public void _exitedZone(Zone zone)
        An internal method intended to be called exclusively by Zone when this entity has been removed from the zone. Specifically, this removes the zone from the internal zone list, and fires a EntityZoneExitedEvent.
        Parameters:
        zone - the zone that was exited

      • getController

        public <T extends Controller> T getController(Class<T> clazz)
        Gets the controller that provides an implementation for the given class. While there is no strict requirement as to the actual type of class provided, by convention it should be the highest-level interface that can provide the required functionality, and not a concrete class.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the controller type
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class for which to get a Controller instance
        Returns:
        a Controller implementation for the given class, or null

      • setController

        public <T extends Controller> T setController(Class<T> clazz,
                                     Controller impl)
        Registers the given implementation of a controller for the given controller class. Note that the implementation must be a subclass of the specified controller class, otherwise an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown. Once set, the given controller is immediately activated (specifically, Controller.onActivated(Entity) is called) and it can begin functioning. Any existing controller will first be deactivated, and then returned.

        Note that a null implementation may be provided. In this case, any existing controller is deactivated.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the controller type to register
        Parameters:
        clazz - the class to provide an implementation for
        impl - the implementation to active
        Returns:
        the previous Controller implementation, or null if none exists.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - when an invalid controller type is provided

      • purgeControllers

        public void purgeControllers()
        Deactivates and removes all controllers currently associated with this Entity.

      • getView

        public <T extends Zone> View<T> getView(Class<T> zoneType)
        Gets this entity's View implementation for the given zone type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the zone type
        Parameters:
        zoneType - the zone type's class reference
        Returns:
        the current View implementation for the given zone type, or null

      • setView

        public <T extends Zone> View<T> setView(Class<T> zoneType,
                               View<T> view)
        Sets this entity's View implementation for the given zone type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - the zone type
        Parameters:
        zoneType - the zone class, used for managing implementations
        view - the view implementation
        Returns:
        the previous implementation, if any

      • getRepresentationForZone

        public Entity getRepresentationForZone(Zone zone)
        Retrieves an external representation of this entity for the given zone. This is intended to compliment the possibility of entities existing in multiple zones concurrently, allowing them to "appear" differently in each.

        Clients may decide how (and if) they would like to handle entities defining an external representation. For example, in a 2D zone, clients may decide to render the provided external entity view, but keep all other properties of the original entity. Note that this functionality is never guaranteed, and is not intended to provide any form of "security", as the original (this) entity is still fully exposed to clients.

        By default, this simply returns null; as such, clients should be expected to display only the current entity.

        TODO: this is currently unimplemented elsewhere, and is likely to be ignored completely.

        Parameters:
        zone - the zone for which to retrieve an external representation
        Returns:
        an (optionally used) external representation of this entity within the given zone, or null if none is defined.
